title.narrative: 1.5 POLIO ERADICATION

description.narrative: By 2017, caregivers of children under 5 years continue to accept and demand polio vaccination and have access to quality vaccines that will contribute to polio eradication., which contributes to Immunization, Polio Eradication. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, the most disadvantaged children and women are accessing an integrated package of high impact, good quality health and nutrition services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, caregivers of children under 5 years continue to accept and demand polio vaccination and have access to quality vaccinesthat will contribute to polio eradication.

description.narrative: UNICEF with Government and PEI partners has supported the vaccination of 38 million children in every NID and approximately 20 million children per SNIDs As of 29 December, 08 wild poliovirus cases were confirmed from 07 districts, compared to 20 cases from 14 districts in 2016, a 60 % reduction. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2017
